Package com.github.flowersinthesand.spheres

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Action<T>
    An action.
    Actions<T>
    A manager for a set of Actions.
    App
    Interface representing the Spheres application.
    AppInside
    The AppInside provides services for internal use only and any operation on this instance affects only local application.
    AppInsideAware
    Interface to inject the AppInside.
    Bridge
    As a bridge between the application and the real server, Bridge maps server-specific connection objects to transport entities as typical glue code does.
    HttpExchange
    Represents an HTTP request-response exchange.
    HttpSocket
    The HttpSocket is a protocol-specific socket that is established in the HTTP protocol.
    Identifiable
    Interface for entity that is needed to be identifiable.
    Initable
    Interface to initialize the component.
    MessageHolder
    Holder wrapping a message object.
    Messenger
    Messenger follows the publish and subscribe model from Java Message Service.
    Protocol
    The Protocol provides HttpSocket, WsSocket and SessionBase.
    SerializableAction<T>
    In the case where the application is clustered, to call App's methods retrieving session like App.all(Action), action to be passed should be able to be serialized.
    SessionBase
    The SessionBase is provided as an amorphous base interface for the Session interface that is a final interface for the application developer to interact a remote endpoint in realtime following the protocol.
    Socket
    The Socket is an interface to generalize identifiable physical connectivity between the endpoints established on any transport.
    SocketBase
    A base interface for all socket interface.
    Taggable
    Interface for entity that is able to be tagged.
    TaggableSupport<T>
    Useful version of Taggable.
    Transport
    The Transport is entity carrying text message or binary message.
    UriAccessor
    A mixin interface for an object that has a URI.
    WebSocket
    Represents the WebSocket API by W3C.
    Wrapper
    Interface to retrieve the provider-specific components.
    WsSocket
    The WsSocket is a protocol-specific socket that is established in the WebSocket protocol.

    HTTP request methods.
    HttpExchange.Status
